article_text:
Photo: Getty Images

Employees spend eight hours a day with their coworkers during the workweek. That may be more time than they spend with their families. Seeing the same people day in and day out, year after year, can build strong bonds and teamwork — or it can drive an employee nuts.

Read: 5 tips for improving employee feedback

article_metadata.description: These employees take a heavy toll on coworkers — and the bottom line.

Read: 5 tips for improving employee feedback
Seeing the same people day in and day out, year after year, can build strong bonds and teamwork — or it can drive an employee nuts.
Photo: Getty ImagesEmployees spend eight hours a day with their coworkers during the workweek.
That may be more time than they spend with their families.
